server

Class GameEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • server.GameEngine

  • public class GameEngine
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is part of the "World of Zuul" application. "World of Zuul" is a very simple, text based adventure game. This class creates all rooms, creates the parser and starts the game. It also evaluates and executes the commands that the parser returns.
    Version:
    2018-02-28
    Author:
    Christer Sonesson

    • Method Detail

      • interpretCommand

        public boolean interpretCommand(java.lang.String commandLine,
                                Player p)
        Given a command, process (that is: execute) the command.
        Parameters:
        commandLine - The command to process.
        p - The Player object to execute the command for.
        Returns:
        True if the command changed some state of the game, false otherwise.

      • getPlayers

        public java.util.List<Player> getPlayers()
        Returns the players currently connected to this server.
        Returns:
        The registered/connected players on this server.

      • getStartRoom

        public Room getStartRoom()
        Returns initial room for all newly created players.
        Returns:
        The starting room.

      • addPlayer

        public void addPlayer(Player newPlayer)
        Adds a player to the game, called when a new client connects.
        Parameters:
        newPlayer - The new player object to add for the newly connected Client.

      • removePlayer

        public void removePlayer(Player disconnectedPlayer)
        Removes a player object from the game, called when a client disconnects.
        Parameters:
        newPlayer - The player object to remove; associated with the disconnecting Client.

      • getRoom

        public static Room getRoom(java.lang.String roomDescription)
        Finds the current version of the room with roomDescription as its short description. Used for loading saved rooms.
        Parameters:
        roomDescription - The short room description of the searched room.
